name: Mick Jagger

instructions: Ibuprofen (400mg) to be taken every 8 hours with food to manage postoperative pain and inflammation. Do not exceed 3 doses per day.
Acetaminophen (500mg) may be used as needed for nighttime pain. Do not exceed 4 grams in 24 hours.
Metformin (850mg) should be continued twice daily with meals. Regular blood glucose monitoring is advised.
Avoid any medications containing penicillin or shellfish due to documented allergies.
Use an asthma inhaler as needed in case of respiratory discomfort.
prescription.refill_policy: Postoperative pain medications do not require refills. Metformin may be refilled monthly with clinical monitoring.

at_home: Apply ice to the knee twice a day for 15 minutes, for 3 days.
Perform gentle leg stretches 4 times a day (e.g., 8 AM, 12 PM, 4 PM, 8 PM) for 30 minutes each, for 30 days.
Take 5-minute walking breaks every four hours during the following 15 days to promote circulation.
Elevate the leg with a pillow while resting to reduce swelling.
Use asthma inhaler as needed, especially before physical activity.
Avoid stairs and uneven surfaces during the first 2 weeks post-surgery.
